title.rendered: 5 Mistakes To Avoid During a Bathroom Renovation in Vaughan

content.rendered:
Your bathroom is one of the spaces you use most frequently in your home, so occasionally, you’ll want to update the room to keep it functional and aesthetically pleasing. When you’re interested in home repair services in Vaughan to help with bathroom renovations, it’s important to work with experienced craftsmen such as the team at Handyman Connection. We’ll help you avoid these five common mistakes.

1. Ignoring the Bathroom Fan

One functional feature that is often overlooked in bathrooms is the exhaust fan. The feature is meant to keep your bathroom ventilated, but it is also a perfect trap for humidity. Make sure you clean out existing exhaust fans during bathroom renovations, and if you’re installing a new fan, make sure that it is the appropriate size for your space.

2. Not Having a Clear Plan for Renovations

Failing to have a renovation plan in place is a good way to extend the budget and length of the project. If you take the time to plan out the renovation carefully, you will have a clear understanding of how much the project will cost and have the chance to set a clear timeline for completion because you will know exactly which tasks you need to have done. If you don’t have a plan, you will spend more money on materials you don’t need and may not be happy with the final result of the renovation.

3. Using Poor Spacing

Spacing plays a huge role in a functional bathroom. You may be more focused on the aesthetic appearance of the space, but you need to think about functionality if you are doing more than replacing a vanity. Different states have building guidelines regarding spacing for bathroom fixtures, so it’s important to understand your locality’s regulations to ensure that you comply. Doing so ensures that there is enough space between your toilet and vanity for you to use them easily.

4. Having an Unrealistic Budget

A bathroom renovation can be an expensive project, so setting a budget is important if you don’t want to overtax your wallet. Knowing what you can afford in terms of bathroom upgrades helps you choose the most important elements first. Regardless of how well you budget, extra costs will arise, so you should budget up to 20% more than the estimated cost to ensure you can afford it.

5. Using the Wrong Materials

You can use many materials in your bathroom, but remember that the humidity in the space can damage many materials. You should always prioritize materials that are intended to be used in bathrooms. Opting for wallpaper that is designed for high-humidity environments will last much longer than traditional wallpaper. Similarly, choosing treated wood, metal and ceramic will allow you to create a beautiful space that will last for many years. If you choose substandard materials, you may need to renovate your bathroom more frequently.

Choosing the Right Contractor To Help

You don’t want to trust your bathroom renovations with just anyone. You need to work with a contractor who will take the time to understand your vision and keep you involved throughout the process to make sure you are happy with the final project. The team at Handyman Connection meets all of these criteria. We staff craftsmen who have the tools, knowledge and experience necessary to create your ideal bathroom.

Make an Appointment Today for a Quote

A bathroom renovation is a big project, so unless you are an experienced contractor with the right tools for the job, you shouldn’t tackle it yourself. Handyman Connection has a team of skilled craftsmen ready to help with your project, so contact us today to discuss your vision and get a quote.
